comments.text: great spot, I got a lift in 5 seconds to Limerick!
Pretty good spot, nice pullover, bu tvisibility is mediocre
We hitchhiked here two and after 10sec, a car stop for us, just the perfect spot :-)
be careful you need to walk 10km to galway center and in bus (citylink, it's 4 euro)
It's a long, long walk from Galway's city center, but you'll be gone in no time.
very good for west cork
a long walk from Cork (30-40 mins) but you can get a lift very quickly.
to get out to here either catch the No 5 or 8 bus as far as CIT or walk (about an hour from city center) then ask for the bishopstown roundabout.. you can hitch to macroom and bantry from here too
Great spot to hitch out to west Cork.

It's really really nice place to find a ride to Cork. I stood at entrance of petrol station with sign ,no more 5 min after a driver picked me.
You can pay 3.05 Euro to take bus 69 from city centre to here.
This information is incorrect, you should not be looking for rides to Cork from here on to the west of the country. Cork is south west.
Amazing spot I was asked if I wanted a ride the moment I stepped into the station.
Petrol Station for Cork, Limerick, etc.

2ppl, monday lunchtime, dir. Clifden.

Right after we walked to the intersection, a car stopped and took us to Clifden. Intersections like these are really nice I think, since the cars have to slow down, making it easier for them to stop and take you.
You'll be gone in no time in any direction. Heading to Galway, the quicker way might be to head north towards Maam Cross and then take the main road.
Good spot lots of room to pull over !
We got a lift in 15 min to Ennis from here (we were going to Galway). There is a bus bay which is quite long so the cars can stop easily.
Super sweet old couple picked us up on their way to Galway on Sunday morning around 11am
There is a lay-by here, but really anywhere along this road is safe to stop cars. We waited around 10 minutes for a lift to Clifden.
It does really work here !

Great place to go to either Limerick city, M18 Ennis/Galway or M7 Dublin. A sign might help because drivers might be going in any one of the 3 directions. Its almost the last stop before the motorway starts.
On the main road to Limerick, between the bus stop and the tourist office.
We were going to the cliffs of Moher and got a lift to a town on the way. Waiting time 15min.
Got ice cream at the gas station and  picked up 10 min later!
Another good spot on the way to Lahinch/Cliffs of Moher, theres also a gas station here so good space for cars to stop. Average wait 10-15 mins.
Waiting times between 2 and ten minutes.
very easy to find a lift because you just have 10 min to join Waterford ..
Picked in 5 minutes! Be careful not to be so close to roundabout cause if not cars will see you too late  to stop.
Hitched a truck here. Cars going fast so try to hitch close to roundabout.
had just put out my thumb and had a lift already- good spot

Stand just beyond the entrance to the Westwood Hotel. Walk here from town, or get the 4W bus, and ask to be dropped off on the Thomas Hynes Rd. From there, walk N. to the Westwood Hotel. For Clifden, Oughterard, north and west Connemara, and the scenic route to Co. Mayo.
Got a lift to Limerick very quickly.

There is a perfect and very long space for the car to stop. The guy who brings me here, said he hitchhike a lot here.
Perfect place to hitchhike.

If you  want to go to the Highway, this is the best spot I think. Lot of space to stop. 
But it's hard to find a lift from Ennis anyway...
Me and my girlfriend waited only for 3/4 minutes here and we got a ride to Cork.
Good spot from the airport to the city. Good traffic as well and the cars are slow coming out from the roundabout. Waiting time 10 minutes.
Great spot to get a lift to Kilemore abbey or Westport. A little carpark on the leftside to let people stop. Waiting time : 5min
Nice spot to reach the coast (Louisburgh, Kinnadoohy, Croagh patrick) ! Waiting time : 10min
Perfect place if you want to go to Lehinch. Cars can stop in the arking, and go slowly
Good sport to  Ennis
Wide new road with plenty of space to pull over. Hitched to Maynooth from here.
HH partner went to shop to get coffee and I was minding bags. Guy came over to pump tires in his car and he was commenting about our big bags... 5 minutes later and we are off to Oughterard! ;)

A good place toward Mallow.
Even if it's the best place for cars to stop. You can really easily find a lift.
Plenty of space, and cars are going to be going slow after the roundabout - perfect for going to Carrick, or Sligo. Just go to the other side of the roundabout for Dublin!
Hard shoulder. Space to pull over. Cars going slowly after roundabout. Most cars will be heading taking M6 towards Dublin.
Not so many cars but people are really friendly!
Car stopped while I was walking towards roundabout to start HHing, excellent place :D.
Nice spot for HHing. There is quite comfortable place for a car to stop and HHiker is visible from quite far.
Mixed fortunes, sometimes 5 minutes, sometimes 1 hour.
The classic spot for hitching to Dingle or Castlegregory direction. I usually hitch a little bit further out the road, outside Poff motors where there is space for cars to pull in.
Can have mixed fortunes here, sometimes I get picked up after waiting 5 minutes other times 2 hours. Anyways, lots of cars, good visibility and space for pull in.
Outside Moran's petrol station. Great spot as cars are still going slowly. For Tralee and everywhere else beyond.
There's small parking near the cemetery. Very good place to hitchhike to Glendalough.
Nice spot for hitching to Ennis and beyond. Lots of space to pull over, and some cars are going slowly after the traffic light.
Right in front of Killarney Garden Centre with plenty of space to pull over and relatively slow cars. Good spot for getting a ride to Tralee.

A good spot for heading to Killarney, Tralee, or Co. Kerry generally. There's a bus stop here for cars to pull over, it's near a stop light, and it's within walking distance of a stop on bus 208 (Victoria's Cross).

Good spot on my way to Killarney, large space to stop and good traffic.
But somehow I waited 1h30 here.
bon spot pour aller dans les bearas
A short walk out from the village after a hostel. Theres enough space for the cars and the usual waiting time was 15 minutes.
Good spot towards Skibbereen and Cork city. Hard shoulder to stop, good traffic usually and the cars are not very fast. Used this place several times and the average waiting time was ~20 minutes.
Very good place with a nice view to West Cork. Theres a good hard shoulder for cars to stop.
Good place towards West Cork, theres an entrance of an old factory or something which is great for cars. Got a lift in seconds.
Just ask for Wexford - Waterford is too ambitious if you don't want to be waiting for hours
very easy to find a lift after the ferry
Got a lift in a few minutes to Ennis. There's a bay for cars what is perfect to stop.
We were extremely lucky because we got a lift to Galway from here from a guy who was surfing here. We only had to wait for a few minutes.
Very good spot on the way to the Cliffs of Moher. There is a parking lane which is perfect for the cars to stop. We got a lift just to the next village but in a few seconds!
Very good place, good traffic and place to stop on the edge of the road. It was dark but got a lift to Cork quite easily.

Perfect to stand, every car can see you soon enough, much space to stop. Just go there  and thumb :-) I waited about 10 minutes. Got a lift to the Bog Village Museum (between Killorglin and Glenbeigh). Cars go to Killorglin at least.

Good spot with lots of cars.
We wait 5min to find a car with a board written "North" in order to join the Connemara.

Hitchhiking to the Mourne mountain (Northern Ireland).
Lots of place and traffic, so it is a very good place

Hitchhiking in the Mourne Mountains (Northern Ireland).
Wait 5 min.
Lots of traffic but the place to stop is not big so be quick and be careful.

Hitchhiking to reach the Mourne mountains (Nerthern Ireland).
Wait 5 min.
Lots of traffic and place to stop
NOT CORRECT!!!!!!!! M4 is to the west. Naas is by the M7 which is to the south west Limerick, Cork, Kerry, and branches off to M9 Kilkenny, Waterford
Going towards Maynooth, M4 motorway for Galway and the West of Ireland.
One ferry all the hour during the day in winter. It's 5 € for a passenger but you find easily a car.
You can ask the people who are waiting for the ferry. Fare is per car, no matter how many persons.
Galway direction.
Donegal direction.
Well, I guess it isn't legal spot anymore. After 30mins of hitchhiking airport police stopped and told us to leave immediately.. (August 2012)
This spot is legal to stand at, unlike the other spot further up, which is under motorway regulations. You need a sign, since there will be north and southbound traffic. An excellent spot.
We got picked up three times here, good spot, slow traffic with plenty of room to stop! Good place if you wanted to walk to here from Letterfrack.
Decent sport still in the town
hitch from here on numerous occasions, just on the bend accross from the garda station. locals are quick to stop. never have more than ten minutes max
i hitch from here once or twice, i have never waited more that five minutes for a lift.

you can easily get a lift on short distance practically everywhere along the road. tested in Doolin, Cliffs of Moher, Liscannor.

If you can't get immediately a ride, walk a bit towards your direction and show the thumb when a car approaches along the road, usually they have no problems to stop in any point!
going to cork city

Very good place for direction Macroom, Killarney. Take the bus from the University College to the last station. Ask the driver for the way to the national road. He has to go there anyway and might take you a little further than the last station.
To Kinsale. A short cycle from Cork City. Definatly fastest pick up time.
Average time to get a lift is 15mn
To get to Lahinch or Corofin stand just after the roundabout. Lots of people hitch here and its a well known spot.
When taking a ferry to France you have 23 hours to talk to everyone on board and get a lift all the way to your final destination.
Good places around edges of town for the West (Galway, etc) and East (Dublin, etc)
Stand at petrol station for Cork, etc.
Very useful spot for Dublin
Great spot for the North and the South

Going to Waterford, once you passed the ring road roundabout, anywhere past Springhill Hotel is good but a little further on nearer to the Rugby Club is perfect for cars to pull in.Only waited 10 minutes when I stopped at the rugby club

I was dropped off at Kilmeaden as it attaches to the Cork Road. But i think the map is wrong here.Anyway, Going to Cork, I waited 5 minutes at the bus stop in the village before the Centra Shop.Its a busy road which i do believe the village is on the main Cork-Waterford Road
Going to tramore, once you get to the bus stop opposite Superquinn, load of cars travelling for the short journey.Otherwise you could get the bus for â‚¬3
Spot for Naas and motorway for Cork and Limerick
For Limerick and the South West. There is space at the traffic lights near the church in the town.
Stand at Esso service or across the road to hitch towards Dublin or towards Limerick.
Stand at Picnic area or across the road to hitch towards Dublin or towards Limerick.
Direction Tuam, Sligo, Letterkenny, Derry. There is some place to pull over near petrol station. You can get nearby by bus no. 8.
Direction Letterkenny, Derry. It's about 20 min. walk from Donegal Town. Emergency lane to pull over.
Stand in emergency lane after the roundabout for the road towards Dublin.
The spot to get out of Buncrana.
Somewhere around here, there's a petrol station with pull-over space which will be your ticket to freedom. It's a fair walk from a lot of probable spaces where you might be dropped off, though.
Great place, even though cars are going past really fast - there'll be enough time and space for them to see you, make up their mind and stop.
Towards West Mayo
Hitch right after the bridge - ample space for cars to pull over, and a pub to seek shelter if it doesn't stop raining.
Good spot to go south from Westport.
Great spot towards Cork.
Weirdly enough, this is the fastest way to get out of Ireland from Kilkenny (via the Rosslare ferry).
If you're incidentially going towards Freshford, this place will do you wonders.

Amazing spot for catching lifts to Dublin - cars are slow as they are just coming out of the roundabout, and there is a huge hard shoulder to pull over into. It's now a motorway, so you might possibly be doing something illegal, though.
There is a toll booth. The road splits in two - direction Limerick and direction Cork. Stand just behind ticket booth. Waited less than one minute
Last traffic lights before M50 bypass (Junction 7). You can get here by buses 25, 66, 67 from Pearse Str.
it was really friendly grandmother

2ppl, Tuesday evening, dir. Mulranny.

Almost dark, hitched at the exit from the gas station.

2ppl, Tuesday afternoon, direction Mallaranny.

Made sense to try after the roundabout and it worked well.

2ppl, tuesday morning, direction north.

Many cars passing, but it took us 15 mins to get a lift to Letterfrack. Okayish spot, but not ideal since it is after the bend.

2ppl, Sunday afternoon. Initially wanted to go to Killarney, stood with a KERRY sign (county Kerry). But we got the ride to Galway instead, and we didn't regret. 

Good spot for several directions. Cars can go quite fast already, so having a big sign is a good idea.

2ppl, wednesday evening, direction Limerick. We decided to get dropped off here, since our driver was only going to Naas. We found a ride immediately, asking the first van driver. Probably very lucky us, but it seemed nevertheless like a good spot. Moderate traffic.

2ppl, wednesday afternoon. We came from Dundalk, wanting to get a ride towards Limerick. Our strategy was to find a ride from someone going past Dublin to Red Cow (a Luas stop, on the west side of Dublin), take the Luas and then continue from there hitchhiking west to Limerick.

The strategy worked quite well, as we found that person really soon. We asked around at the entrance of the station.
2ppl, wednesday afternoon, direction Dublin. Big service station in the direction of Dublin. Stood at the exit with the sign.
2ppl, wednesday afternoon, direction Dublin. Found a ride quite shortly to the next service station south from here. We found this roundabout to be much safer spot than the other one on the ramp.
2ppl, tuesday evening. We found a ride immediately towards Northern Ireland. We asked people on the gas station.
Perks include shade trees, slower speeds, long space to stop, and good visibility.
Good spot. Cars can pull over. Thumbing works very well all over Donegal and I got an easy lift to Carndonagh
After the bus stop there is space to Park it's great
Next to the gaz station it's really good, we waited for 1 minute and a guy took us to camp
If you‘re hitchhiking from Mountshannon, this is the best spot to Scarrif, Ennis. It’s a long parking lane or emergency lane and I never had to wait more than a few cars
There is a long emergency lane so I just put my hand out and of of the next cars stopped. They are all very keen to help you.
There is a petrolstation with toilets and all that food stuff. Really kind people around there! A truck driver took me to Dublin.

Went the whole way from the lake to Ennis in the morning on a weekday and I changed cars twice but never had to wait more than a few seconds. In this whole region hitchhiking is really culturally integrated, amazing friendly people.

yup west galway
loads of space, fair amount of traffic going into galway
The first people I asked where heading towards past Killarney so I was very lucky! But a good place to ask around, lots of traffic!
People just drive off from the roundabout and there’s a hard shoulder to pull over to.
Not a bad place, room for cars to pullover. Had a shadow as well.

don't listen to the other spots, this is THE BEST hitching spot to go to Dublin

small space to pull over before roundabout: walk few metres before that and sign from there, very busy sunday mid-day
space to pull over, very busy on Saturday, strawberry booth nearby but very expensive
very busy, loads of room to pull over, everyone here is going to Wexford
good for lifts to the south-east coast, space to pull over, good visibility, busy road on early Saturday morning
hitched from here a good few times, never waiting more than 20 minutes for a ride to Galway or Clare. can ask for rides from the rest stop but can easily just thumb a ride from the on slip.
Good spot, people go slow so they can see you better, we got a lift to the start of carrauntoohill trail by an irish granny.

I got really lucky to get a ride this far. Although people stoped for me often enough all over the island, they usually were locals and not intending to drive out of Achill. During tourism season you might get more rides out.

Autumn 2023
the green just in front of the cafe is a good spot for hitching towards Dublin, one lift often gets you as far as Kilmacanogue where public transport can be got...
I waited a lot for Ireland, but it did work.
A bit long to go there from the city center. But I really think this is the best place to Galway.
Great petrol station for Galawy, etc
Excellent spot, my average waiting time has been about 5 minutes. You can walk here from the city centre (20-30 mins)
Many cars past me, got some funny looks from pedestrians,  but I enjoy it, especially happy for the few kids that seen it works when I got picked up..
Very good place to escape from Dublin towards Wicklow Mountains. Our route: Dublin>Saggart>Blessington>Hollywood>Glendalough

Petrol station for Blessington

It's easy to get there from the City Center by Luas Red Line towards Saggart and then on foot for a while.

Another option: catch Dublin bus nr 65 to stop nr 2576 - Citywest Road, Blessington Road

I must of hitched this route upwards of 30 times in last six years...
I walk out of town as far as this garage as it is an easy place for cars to see form far away and have room to pull in... 
also I stand at the exit of garage cause often drivers pulling out pick up, they have had time to think about it and get a good look at me/have a relaxed chat before deciding...
If I were heading to Glendelough I would take lift as far as Hollywood as a lot of traffic passing through going all the way t
Try ask somebody for a lift here, it's excellent spot
Blessington petrol station.

This is too easy! I hitch to Killarney almost every day just to buy some groceries, normaly it takes 3 minuts, but never stand there longer than 15 minuts, everybody goes to Killarney, 'cause it is still 5km. You stand at the bus stop, and the drivers can already see you from far away. The buses only pass 4 times daily, and walking to Killarney is not necessary although there is a path next to the road that leads you directly in there.
good
got a ride seconds after i put my thumb out. friendly faces and plenty of traffic, good spot for anywhere on the m4

2ppl, Tuesday afternoon, direction Westport.

Quickly found a ride to Leenaun. The driver invited us for the dinner in the hotel as well. Super generous!
Many cars, many commuters. And if, for some strange reason, you don't get picked up, there is an amazing hostel just up the hill from the main junction - the Old Monastery Hostel!
-> Galway city. Good place to stand if you are going into Galway city, rather than on the dual carriageway, if you get a lift as far as Oranmore.
west galway is filled with angels. only good rides going out connemara. got a lift even late in the day directly where we wanted to go.
got a ride here once to Maam's Cross
Good place to hitch if you want to go in direction of Spiddal, or Connemara by the coast road. You can take a bus, to get closer, or it's one hour walking from galway city center.
Took a while to get a lift
After Maxol Station on Limerick Road, wait near bus stop as Its easy for cars to pull in there. Only had to wait 10 minutes

We were 2 to hitchike for tralee. People often stoped to proposed a lift but rarely as far as tralee so best advice is to get a lift to anascaul then hitch to tralee from there. Super duper friendly and nice.
Slightly further up the road outside the football pitch, for Tralee or Killarney.
There are a good few cars in the parking lot, so if you ask the drivers probably they can bring you at least  to the next village.

With a good sign, no tourist stop to pick us up for 1 hour.
Whereas there is place, a good traffic and the car drive quite slow.
We didn't understand why a good spot like that didn't work.
great for rides to limerick, weekday midday got a ride in no time

Good place to go to Limerick. 
Unfortunately, cars go very fast, but there is lot of place for stopping.

There is a gaz station here. Perfect for direction West (Mullingar, Athlone, Galway).
Bus Stop No. 2201. Lucan Road, Palmerstown Drive. Bus 25, 26, 66, 67.
traffic to dublin and east in general, good visibility and space to pull over
After the roundabout and the Aldi there is loads of space for drivers to stop. they don't drive that fast. easy to get short rides
good spot! only con is cars are going quite fast, but great visibility, all the ppl going east from Sligo pass through here, space to pull over
Roundabout outside Summerhill College.
Great if heading to Mallow or Cork. Petrol station now open, but cheaper places to shop in charleville.
There is a closed petrol station what is a very good place for cars to stop. It was getting dark but got a lift in 20 minutes to Mallow.
Got to tralee in 1 ride. Had to wait a while but not too long. Cars can stop easily and people are super friendly, there's just not so much traffic.
I think this place is better for hitching to Tralee than using the spot outside Moran's garage on the N86.
Outside the Dingle Brewery (Crean's) on the Conor Pass road to Tralee ... its a bit awkward for cars to pull in.
Busy at the time (Bank Holiday afternoon). Got lift within 20m. This is the road most people in Letterfrack take for getting to Galway.
Waited here for too long.. Car only every 10 minutes and driving very fast.
Anywhere around there is good, depending which way you want to head. We got picked up twice.
Easy to hitch to Clifden. Maybe a little bit harder for the way to Galway but lots of space for traffic to stop. Plenty of traffic as well for a rural area.

Got a ride all the way to Galway from here! Visibility is not great as there is a hill in the way, but cars are going slowly as they turn left from the R344 (most cars will go in the Galway direction).
I tried there, and a man stops very quickly to bring me near to the highway. But I think this is a good spot.
Good spot if you are going to Galway. There is a stopping lane after the roundabout where the cars can stop easily. The traffic is also good.

If you want to go to west cork, this is a nice spot, .
Unfortunately, sometime, there's very few car, so you can wait a long time ...
Great spot towards Dublin, Athlone etc, but hard to reach without having hitch-hiked before. Waiting time : 5min
Good spot to reach Clifden and Galway. It's a good idea to wait tourists getting out from Inishbofin's ferry, more chances to get a lift ! Waiting time : 20min
Average spot for Westport and Leenaun : possibiliy to ask directly the Adventure park's staff . Waiting time : 20min
Good spot, enough place on the road-side. Good for reach Longford, Castlebar, Westport etc. Waiting time : 15min
Just past church entrance. Not much space to pull over, but cars should be going slow enough. Got ride fairly quickly.

The motorway junction was super busy one afternoon so I decided to walk up to here. Got a lift all the way to Galway pretty quickly!
No hard shoulder, but I stood in front of a wide entrance...
Some parking spaces beside housing estate. Traffic going quite slowly, but careful with the bends. Got lift quite quickly!
Stood a bit closer to Kinvara. Took only 10 minutes. Weather was also awful! ;)
There's a nice slip road with plenty of space to stop (if you're going westbound) We had the unfortunate weather and had to wait just over an hour but got all the way to Doolin.
Just walk past roundabout at university entrance... plenty of space for cars to pull over. Probably more local traffic than if you hitch from motorway junction, but you should get a ride quicker.
Some parking spaces where cars can pull over. At edge of town speed limit area so cars going fairly slow.
Straight section with hard shoulder after BMW dealership. For direction Longford, Carrick, Sligo, etc. You could also try before the dealership (suggestion from a driver who picked me up here).
Was picked up withing minutes. Very easy if heading west.
This entire stretch is good for pickups and is traveled well. Wont take long.
I liked this spot a lot. Lots of room, a lot of traffic thanks to the road to the beach.

It was during the week (in the morning) when I tried to get a lift to Dublin. It was damn windy and I froze terribly. After approx. 1 1/2 hours a nice lady took my finally halfway to Dublin! This was the second car the stopped. The other one just wanted to make fun of me haha
The only way to get towards Dublin or Waterford. Bring a sign, it's right before a big un-hitch-able junction!
Indeed not really good for cars to stop, but the locals didnt really care.
Not the best place for cars but they can stop on the footpath and the local are very friendly, usual waiting time was 10-15 minutes.
Decent spot with large space for cars to stop. Prepare yourself for a low traffic though, but the people are friendly in the countryside.
Nice spot towards Ballina. Theres a petrol station with hard shoulder and the cars are slow enough. Though lots of the traffic is local.
A good place if you are going down to Blacksod.
Very good place to stop, however my waiting time was quite long, around 40 minutes. A good 15 minutes out from town.
A small but big enough place for cars to stop. There are two roads towards Ballina, this one is more used by the locals, the other is the main road and the traffic is better there.
A good walk out from the city, but theres a good place for cars towards Headford, Castlebar, Ballina.
Good place if you are hedaing to the city. Hard shoulder to stop.
A 10 min walk out from town but it is worth it, hard shoulder for cars to stop. Toward Limerick, Galway.
A bit of a walk from town, but max 15 minutes but its worth it. Good place for cars to stop toward Cork city.
Nice enough spot to Baltimore, just 5 mins outside of town. Used the spot a good few times usually had to wait for 15-20 minutes.
Good spot towards Bantry or Killarney. Hard shoulder for cars to stop, just outside of the village.
If you are walking out from Bandon you just pass the traffic lights and there's a hard shoulder for cars where they can stop. Recommended by a local. Got a light in 2 min.
heading west cork along N71
Got a lift here and the next on to Cork pretty easy. However consider its the motorway and it's not really allowed to do.
But consider if the Garda spots you probably they take you from the motorway.
It's on the motorway under a bridge so you have a dry place if it's raining. Traffic toward Cork, Limerick etc. It was easy to get a lift.

There's a small bay normally for roadworks but a car can stop there. You can get the bus 13 from the city close to here and the traffic from this lane goes to Cork, Limerick etc.
Otherwise it's pretty difficult around the motorway.
Direction Newport. Not the best place for a car to stop, but still they stop here quite often.

Maam's Cross
the hotel on the spot there looks a bit like the one in the Shining
got a ride there almost evening all the way to Leenaune
great place for heading to Galway - everybody's going there, and there's quite a bit of traffic. Going south into Connemara is a bit harder, because there's less traffic, but it's still very doable.
Nice place on the way to Cork. It was getting dark but got a lift in 15 minutes.
Good place to hitch, it was almost dark but got a lift in a few minutes.
Not the safest spot, and the cars are quite fast, but we were lucky and got a lift to Limerick in a few minutes.
Got a lift to the next village in a few minutes.
Great for getting into Galway, just follow this road until the sidewalk ends. Loads of cars, plenty of room for them to pull over, we got picked up in less than 5 min :)
We got a lift to the next village (Liscannor) so wwe got closer to the cliffs. The traffic was low (end of november) but only had to wait for 15 min.

Good spot to hitchhike close to the golf club.
Good traffic and place to stop the car.
We wait 1min to go to Cliff of Moher.
Good place to hitch direction Galway. Plenty of place for the cars to stop.

There is a small entrance, before the bend, where a way starts going up a hill to a private estate. You can thumb there, as well as without a sign. Once I waited 10 minutes for a lift to Fossa (before Killarney) If you are not successful, just go along further the street on the lefthand side and thumb by walking. I did that twice, and got a lift after 5 minutes or less.
Much space to stop. Despite standing behind the bend, cars are not too fast. We got a lift to Tralee after 15 minutes.
Much space to stop. Waited 30 minutes to get a lift to Cahersiveen.

There is an entrance that is not used (august 2013) (construction site or something), so you can stand there and be sure that all the cars that flashes do it to pick you up. I waited 15 minutes to get a lift to Glenbeigh.

Enough place to stand and to stop despite this bend. Direction Glenbeigh, it is better to hitch from there, than from opposite to the Bog Village Museum about 200m before where it is not possible to stand except directly on the road. I waited 3 minutes for a lift to Glenbeigh.
We got a lift in a few minutes to the entrance of the cliffs. The traffic is low, but everybody knows that you are going to the cliffs so they are quite helpful.

Dublin direction.
Wait 15 min
Good traffic but it is quite dangerous because the cars drive fast and there is not too much place.

Very got spot for Cliff of Moher.
We wait 5min.
Good spot if you're headed towards the cliffs of Moher.

Hithhiking to clif of Moher,
With a board written " South", my friend and me wait 10min.
Good traffic and place for the car

We were walking from the centre of Galway to go out of the city and to go on the road to Doolin. We finally stopped here (there is a bus stop) and nearly the first car took us. The problem can be, here there is lots of directions..
Good spot, but in Low season, it's really quiet.

Reenabulliga, Studio MeetingPoint.
Eine Anlaufstelle von Pictic meetingPoints
http://www.pictic.net/meetingpoints/
hier wird einem weitergeholfen. Kleine Snacks oder Tee und Kuchen gegen Donation.
Best spot for hitching North, opposite the North Point centre.
For hitching Enniskillen/Belfast direction
Dual carriageway at Carrowroe.
Roundabout outside Summerhill College

I got a ride past the check-in. A family of four already had their ticket booked, but the check-in staff member didn't see me sitting, so I got in for free. Normally they charge per passenger, so the change of this happening is rather small. Paying as an extra passenger is still cheaper than paying as a foot passenger. After the check-in you can easily talk to drivers to ask whether they are going in your direction after the ferry, if you initial ride isn't.
A lot of people commute between Oughterard and Cliffden so you got a good chance. The car park was perfect for us.
If headed to Belmullett you'll get a lift quickly enough
Most people seem to stop, though sometimes there's few cars driving by to begin with.
A lovely green spot with a nice view and ample space for cars to pull over. It's on some sort of private slip road.
Stand just a few feet away from the bus stop, close to the road. You can get to Greystones, Bray, and hitch-hike from there.
Not a bad spot for getting into Bray, or into areas of Dublin. A few feet away from the bus stop, close to the road.

To get to Blessington or Baltinglass, Naas, etc, hitch-hike from here through Laragh to Hollywood (R756), also known as Wicklow Gap.

You could try to go through R759 to Blessington (Sally Gap), not such a safe road though!
N4 (M4 -> N6 and N4) to Galway, Sligo, Westport, Ballina, Longford, Athlone, Mullingar. Stand a few metres in front of the bus stop. Any 25, 66 or 67 from Pearse Street (opposite the police station).

Stand at the brow of the hill on the way out of the village, where a road turns off to the left, or at the bottom of the hill by the car park. Any further out and they cars will be going far too fast. Almost everyone here will be driving to Galway.
To Limerick and Dublin. After the roundabout after Adare Manor. Good space for a car to stop and pull in. If you need to be let out at Adare on your way from Kerry to Limerick, this is the best spot.
Side of road just after roundabout. For Cork, etc.
Stood on footpath at Silver Spings Moran's Hotel. Waited 20 mins to get to Dublin
These traffic lights are a good spot to get out of Cork at. Lots of traffic going to Mallow etc.
Just infront of the Garda Station this is a decent spot i use regularly going to Ennis/Limerick. Average waiting time is about 15 minutes.
Decent spot if you're heading to Nenagh/Limerick. Waited about 10 mins for a lift.
To Loughrea/Athlone. Good busy spot
For Limerick and the South West. There is alot of local traffic so it could be wise to put "Mountrath" on your sign as this town nearby has many service stations.
Going to Carlow.Waited opposite the Health Board. Waited 15 minutes
going to Kilcrohane, u take the road to Durrus I waited 10 minutes for a local to pick me up but sometimes you might have to wait longer as its a quiet road down the Sheep's Head
After roundabout there is space for cars to pull over. Direction Galway, etc.
Service station for cars going to Port Laois. Only use if one has problems at motorway exit.
Use motorway exit for cars going towards Portlaoise. There is a petrol station nearby if you have any problems.
Service station on Tullow road. Plenty of space for cars to pull over.
Space beside bus stop for vehicles to stop. Direction Dublin, etc.
Spot for Galway or Limerick, in walking distance from the airport terminal. If somebody offers you a lift just to the N18 dual carriegeway go for it. You can easily hitch on the junction's sliproads.
Good spot for the direction North (Ennis, Galway).

GO OUT FROM DUBLIN BY M4
Here is a really interesant place to hitch, the first car was my driver, why ? cause there is like one car every 5 minutes, and she's know that she's alone.
Speed : 0km/h
Traffic : really few
Sign : Asking for next gas station

DIRECTION ENNIS
quiet cool spot near from the supermarket
Speed : 40 km/h
Traffic : low
Sign : Ennis
Just past the bus stops. Got a lift here after about 2 minutes at 10.30pm in the rain, im sure it was just luck but its not a bad spot. traffic moves slowly.
small deal to get out of letterkenny from here.
Good spot towards Cork or Mallow

Bit of a hard spot to hitch down to Kenmare; there is no space to pull over. But then again, there's not a huge lot of cars, so people can just stop in the middle of the road, and they will. Should be a decent spot to hitch towards Cork on the N22, too.
This is a pretty decent place to get out of New Ross (why would anybody want to leave New Ross, though?)
You can get onto the Motorway here - it will take you some time, but that's kinda normal for getting onto an Irish Motorway. Also, you can easily sleep under the bridge, if it's warm enough.
heading out of wexford towards rosslare europort
Ask around for lifts towards Dublin or Waterford at the two petrol stations that are here. Most traffic will at least head to the roundabout where the motorway to Dublin starts.

if youre leaving tuam (direction galway) from this roundabout then hitch on the N83 exit instead of the motorway entrance. cars are more likely to stop for you along this road than the motorway, and its generally safer and youre more likely to get a lift quicker. i got a ride here in two minutes in the middle of november even though it was almost dark.

caught a lift straight to ennis early monday morning. anywhere on the oranmore bypass is good but this spot will catch all the traffic leaving town and its right after a roundabout so cars are slowed  :-)

2ppl, monday morning, dir. Clifden.

Low traffic, so it was not a problem for the car to stop on the road. The car took us just a bit up north. Nice but expensive cafe close to the spot, to charge batterries.
pretty much every car going direct to galway uses this road - also good for rides to ballinrobe, headford etc.
Good spot with visibility and room to pull over. Cars are going a bit fast.
One of the first really good spots south of Dublin to hitch south. Could be better with more long distance traffic.

The ferry from Buncrana to Rathmullan is hitchable. It is paid by car and you can easiely talk to the cars waiting for the ferry. The ferry goes every hour, but can only take roundabout 20 cars. But you will probably find someone to take you.

cutest ride w a dog on my lap I was in heaven and life was great,
petrol station buzz, not that much traffic took us (2ppl) 20mins or so to get a ride, good visibility, space to pull over
Great spot after the college next to the roundabout, feels a bit unsafe but it's actually safe
People are coming from boyle and can see your sign quite good, the others on the N4 are driving quite fast but you still got quite some space for them to Park and you to be safe
Good spot, space to Park, a lot of cars are passing by without stopping because it's just before the roundabout but we got a lift to Limerick!
mostly local drivers, busy crossroads at least at the weekends though, so bound to get a good lift sooner or later. with a sign maybe eady to get a lift to roscommon quicker
good for rides to athlone, got lucky w a lift to galway but lots of south going local drivers. tried thumbing first but got a lift soon after we made a sign for athlone
loads of space to pull over, most traffic local but few cars going to longford (maybe further)
busy, guy asked us if we want a ride as soon as he saw our sign
Many cars past me, got some funny looks from pedestrians,  but I enjoy it, especially happy for the few kids that seen it works when I got picked up..
The only way to hitch towards Dublin, Naas, Carlow, Kilkenny etc. Bring a sign!!
usually this spot is good but on a sunday in august it was slow getting a ride west.
good spot for rides to kinnegad and mullingar, on weekdays havent been able to get a lift further than west meath but maybe worth trying at weekends
Motorway exits for Western Ireland and Dublin
Not the best spot for people to pull in but lots of cars passing by !
I got a ride right here from the airport and then it didn't take long to get all the way to Galway.

Went to carrauntoohill hike with my girlfriend, irish people from the zone seems to dislike hitchhikers, we got help from a french couple, the spot is fine, a lot of traffic and many parts where cars can stop.

There is a cutout, where cars can stop well and where you are still seen by the drivers from a distance. Direction Fossa, Killorglin or Dingle. I always hitch there to the Killarney Youth Hostel, just 5 km further (before Fossa). It takes me a bit longer than hitching into Killarney, however it works well. About 10-15min waiting time.
Nobody goes outside the city here. Go more on east.
Direction East or South to Dublin or Limerick, Cork. This street is part of inner city bypass and there's quite often traffic jam. Perfect spot, just make a sign.
I know the area, this is not really a good hitching spot unless you are heading up in Dublin mountains
For Cork, Limerick etc. Please wait ask all at the service station.
The spot is good. Enough space for the cars to stop. The traffic is not so busy but you will definitely get a lift to the way to Cork.
Stand after bridge for Cork, etc.
Not many cars when we were there, but plenty of space to pull over.
Towards Galway/Sligo/Mayo. Stood by sliplane. Took a while, but might have been bad luck. Maybe better to walk up R407 a little...

Just before the bus stop, good way to catch cars from the exit. To the west (Galway, Athlone, Longford, Westport ...) Waiting time : 15min & 1h45 

Point de stop correct, juste avant un arrêt de bus, moyen d'attraper les véhicules sortants du centre commercial qui n'ont pas encore accéléré. Temps d'attente : 15min & 1h45

Average to spot to join west-Dublin by the circular. Small space to hitchhike but possibilities to meet a pilote from the airport ! Waiting time : 35min 

Spot correct pour poucer, l'espace est maigre, bien qu'il y ait un petit parking. Le trafic est dense mais peu de gens s'arrête. Bon pour rejoindre la rocade et Dublin West pour décoller vers l'Ouest du pays ! Temps d'attente : 35min

One time got lucky, and driver offered a lift while we were drawing the sign.
Second time, I was by myself, and took a bit longer... and the driver only left me up to one of the bypass roundabouts (from where I got a lift all the way to Dublin)
This one was a disaster for me and my friend (female). Waited 1h 50m, and decided to hitch back to Letterfrack again.

In the Spring of 2012, me and my friend (two males) got a lift all the way to Galway. Waited 30 minutes or so (it took us about 40 minutes to get to Galway). Awesome scenery And it's easy to camp in case you get there too late!

Space for cars to pull over but visibility is not amazing... direction Dublin, Tullamore, etc.
(If going to Dublin you'd be better checking the spot I added nearer to the motorway)
A busy petrol station. Very good to ask for to Ennis, Limerick or Galway

Beautiful place to walk and I was picked up by a Buddhist heading to the retreat out here. (only took me that far too)

Roads are thin between Castletownbere & Ballydonegan
Was picked up here after about a 45 minute wait aiming to head west. Not the best spot but it's the widest you've got around.
Someone from Arklow told us about that place. Apparently many hitchhikers use it.
There's a long bus bay and the traffic is even good. Average place for South, e.g. Arklow
Main road to go to Clifden.
Don't get dropped off at the Leenane Hotel. People will think you're staying there, and that doesn't go along with the whole hitching thing :-)
Had to wait for 45 minutes with a sign, but finally got a lift to the next village.
We tried this place twice, and even if the traffic was very good we had to wait 45 mins and after more than an hour, even we had a sign. Maybe just bad luck...

This is just beyond the traffic lights at Galway Crystal and Bodkin's Bar. Bus 4E (Mon - Sat) and bus 9 (every day) will bring you here. Ask the driver to stop at Galway Crystal (on the 9) or at the gate of Merlin Park Hospital (on the 4E). For all points East (towards Dublin) and South (towards Limerick and Cork).
Not the best place to hitchhike, because there is just a small bay for the cars to stop. However we had a good luck only waited for 10 min.
Towards Galway or Loughrea,, there is a stretch where a car can pull up behind you or into the parking area if they want to give you a lift. We waited 30-45 min but maybe that was just bad luck.

It's a good place for hitchhiking to the Dublin city centre, but totally senseless for Belfast directions (even though motorway sings say differently). Three cars stopped us during an hour and told us to give it up, no chance to getting from here to Belfast. At the end we had to take a bus... 
Anyway, cars drive fast, but there's a plenty of space to stop. So make a big sign. Also a lot of taxi drivers drive around and they think and thumb up means we want taxi, so try to not hitchhike them :)

For Wicklow, Greystones, Bray, etc.

Just up the road from Statoil, go onto the green or side of the road and make sure you're visible. This is an average spot.
There's a small footpath near a housing estate on the outskirts of Blessington town, it seems like an average spot, not great.
Walk up the road just to where the cattle market is, this spot is good for visibility and there is a lot of space for cars to park.
Just after the school in Ballymore Eustace, walk up for a short while, there's a footpath, safe place to hitch-hike, ride/lifts shouldn't be too hard to get here.

To get back to Laragh, and Wicklow Town, try hitch-hiking at this petrol station, be patient, but at least the owners don't seem to mind.

It's a bad area if you're going to Blessington, Baltinglass or Naas, and walking on the N81 is a really bad idea.
To get to Glendalough, this isn't too bad a spot, but it can take up to an hour to get a lift/ride.
took a while to get here but after that i think about 5 min later i had a ride
You can get to Maynooth by train. From there you have to walk around 2 km (? as far as I can remember) to get to the motorway. Took us about 45 minutes to get a lift.
Stand a little further than the end of the bridge, where there's a hard shoulder. To Ennis, Limerick and all points north.
Just beyond the bridge, there is a wide lay-by and car park. Lots of stopping room. Many people stop here for a break, so you may even be offered a lift.
Stand at side of road. For Dublin, etc.
Stand at traffic lights and approach stopped cars. Great for Belfast and other places north of Dublin.
In front of the parking lot beside gas station. If your heading towards Ennistymon stay here, the road ahead is fast, twisty and with nowhere for cars to stop.
Eventually got a lift to Gort at this point.
Walk past the travel lodge, over the bridge. theres a Maxol garage (i think) on the left. Got a lift to dublin after about 5 minutes.
Wasnt sure exactly where to put the marker. Stand at the football pitch for lifts to Athone/East
Going to Kilkenny,waited 40 minutes as its not a busy road.Once you get past Lidl roundabout, you're laughing but there isnt a high volume of traffic going that direction.

DIRECTION KILRUSH
Don't walk too much cause tha car are going too fast next and can't stop anywhere, so stay near from the city
Speed : 40km/h
Traffic : 5 cars/min
Sign : Kilrush
There's a little lay-by just beyond the bridge, but people don't seem to feel very confortable about stopping there for you.
This spot isn't perfect, but the best central option for hitching towards Galway.

walked north west along the ennis road with my thumb out and a sign for Galway. i got a lift just before the roundabout all the way to Tuam. most people driving to galway or ennis will leave limerick along this road and theres plenty of space along this road for cars to pull over with the bike lane and cars are going slow.

good spot for getting out of galway south bound. take bus 404 to oranmore north and walk back a bit to the roundabout. better for rides to Ennis or limerick than trying to hitch on the motorway by the clinic.
lots of traffic on weekday morning
Not very busy. Waited with "Galway" sign and got a ride to Oranmore.
Mostly local traffic, but generous shoulder.

traffic was diverted through here because of a crash on the m4 so there was loads of cars going by, probably less busy on other days. small amount of space to pull over after the roundabout and youre fairly visible to drivers.
not loads of traffic
local traffic not going far, some space to pull over, lovely horses to look at while youre waiting
got a lift from a nazi, was not fun but spot is ok, mostly local traffic, might get lucky w a lift to athlone, space to pull over
good for getting out of enfield, stand far enough behind the roundabout exit that they have enough time to see you as they drive by
Not the best, but I got a ride with a man whose grandfather was Estonian!! so that was cool!

Spot itself is not bad, there’s two gas stations and room for people to stop. But at that moment I was there there weren’t many people heading very far. Luckily a guy offered to take me to the roundabout in Wexford and from there I can easily get a ride across to Waterford or further. He was kind enough to even buy me fruits and a sandwich for the road.
standing here in front of the road sign for athlone (or better with yr own!) will get u a lift in an hour or two, lots of traffic here going to towns in between as well so possible to leapfrog

if trying to get a ride to galway probably better to start closer to m50, near liffey valley sc, but for what this spot is worth good visibility and room to pull over etc, just not a lot of cars going long distance.
not busy on a sunday morning, probably fine getting lifts from homegoing tourists and light house visitors, got lucky w a lift straight to waterford
not busy at all, loads of room to pull over, when hitching to hook lighthouse maybe easier to go from arthurstown and duncannon

space to pull over, good visibility, not too busy road on Saturday mid-day, mostly local drivers who wouldn't pick up hitch hikers going long distance, started with a sign and got a lift when we only thumbed

space to pull over & good traffic on a saturday evening in summer! good for traffic into roscommon town and from there easy hitch to galway or tuam, i got lucky with a hitch straight to lough rae though
Waited there at a red light. I walked with a sign to each car and one finally stopped. A lot of traffic but people doesn't stop easily.
It was at the morning. I waited a long time and not much cars passed. But one finally stopped and I made an amazing encounter.
Enough space for the cars to stop but the traffic is not the best, this road is not so busy.

not the best spot for hitching south, more drivers would be getting on the motorway at the next entrance, spent an hour here with no luck with sign for Wexford, even on a busy day not a lot of traffic, not a lot of room to pull over
Average spot, it's an exit onto the N11 for Arklow and Wexford.
This spot will force you to be creative ! I think it's better to come back at stokestown's city center to hitchhike. Waiting time to Westport : 40min
Grassy verge with wooden pillars prevent cars from pulling over very easily/safely. If going to Navan/Tara take the R157 instead!
It was not such a good idea to hitchhike here; although the traffic was dense enough, no car stopped for about an hour and a half.

We wanted to reach Kenmare from that place. There's big parking near the Torc Waterfall and many cars stops here, but they're generally tourists with big families. We tried asking drivers but it seemed to be senseless.
Eventually got a lift to Galway. but after a long time.
My third position on this road was just before the entrance to a B&B (cant remember the name). Yet again zero cars stopped.
Worst hitchhiking experience. Two hours but no cars stopped. It was dark but there were thousands of cars passing by. Bad luck.
Im not sure but we were at the Clare east roundabout. A driver stopped here with us, but it was a bad place with bad traffic. But we were lucky and got a lift in 20 mins.
This entire town is a hitching nightmare! Not impossible, but tough.

Hard to get a lift anywhere between here and Kinvara. Road is narrow and not much space to stop and people didn't seem to be going further than few hundred meters. We had to walk pretty much all the way to Kinvara.
Fast cars going past, nowhere safe to hitch avoid getting dropped off here if possible.
The driveway of some house, visibility is average, likelihood of being picked up quite low. This road is fairly unsafe, cars break the speed limit and large trucks go by.
Right at the bus stop, near the Maxol station. Very few lifts offered here.
Such a frustrating road. There is a lot of traffic entering the industrial estate here so i kept getting my hopes up seeing people pulling in to stop only for them to drive through the gates!
I have marked 3 points on this road where i had absolutely no luck getting a lift during a 2 hour period. This one is just at the entrance to Lidl. 0 cars stopped
Moved up the road a bit to a spot just past the car dealership. once again 0 cars stopped.
Not a great place. 45 min wait (maybe i was unlucky)for lift to Ennis. if you are going to Limerick you shouldnt have to wait so long
if a nice old man leaves you here and tells you you can hitch from the bridges he's wrong!
standard rural Irish spot, not much traffic and not much to say, space to pull over the few ppl are driving slow and will see you, even late in the day we got a lift in less than an hour
not very busy, not loads of room to pull over, friendly local was excited to show us the area

not a lot of space for cars to stop but it should b! possible on the grass. we were two male passing ppl and didn't get a ride after 30 mins, tried a little bit further down the road where there's a better spot to pull over but the cars are going faster, but no luck either. gave up after one hour.
The traffic is big in this place, but everyone is turning right towards Gorey. If you want to hitchhike to Wexford, better find another spot.
It's very hard to get out from Glenmalure, there's no traffic at all.
We were trying for almost two hours but no cars stopped. However it was dark and not tourist season (end of November).

-> Galway

rally bad point, no space for car to stop, heavy traffic. didn't manage to get a lift, even at the gas station nearer to the center than the point on the map.

Might be better to reach in other ways the entrance of \"highway\".

Senseless spot to try hitching from - sharp bends without any lay-bys or hard shoulder. Follow the road for about a mile and you'll get to a construction side (as of Sep 10) and perfect hard shoulder after that.

BOOOO 👎👎👎👎 was here ages, even on a Saturday barely any traffic + a lot of people turning off the main road at the crossroads just before.
had the idea to take the bus to next better spot but bus stop might not exist. eventually got lucky with a ride to Carrick but it wasn't hard to see ourselves getting stuck here

Not a very good gas station, but I was nearby so it was my best shot. But if possible I don’t recommend ending up here lol. Most of the people not heading far, or are cautious to take someone. 
I was lucky to get a ride with a family-ran equestrian business owner and they took me to Gorey and then I couchsurfed with them.

drivers going to galway rarely pull into kinnegad rest stop so dont bother asking there or at this roundabout for lifts - if u end up here otw to galway better to find a ride on the m4 to mullingar or edgeworthstown and then go to athlone, see more of the nice countryside and usually fast getting a ride to galway from athlone
Seems like a good spot to go to Dublin. But I waited a loooong time, a lot of people went that way but NOBODY stopped. Terrible.
